description: A peaceful village in East Blue where Roronoa Zoro was born and raised. The village was founded by and named after Shimotsuki Kouzaburou, a samurai from Wano Country. It is home to the Isshin Dojo, where Zoro trained in swordsmanship under Koushirou.

keyEvents.description: Revealed as the location of Zoro's childhood and training
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Zoro's homeland and the place where his dream was born

features: Founded by Shimotsuki Kouzaburou from Wano Country

description: A kenjutsu (swordsmanship) training dojo in Shimotsuki Village, owned and operated by Koushirou. This is where Roronoa Zoro trained as a child and learned swordsmanship. The dojo is most famous for being the place where Zoro and Kuina made their legendary vow to become the world's greatest swordsman.

keyEvents.description: Kuina defeats Zoro for the 2001st time at the dojo
keyEvents.significance: Shows the rivalry between Zoro and Kuina that shaped Zoro's character

keyEvents.description: Zoro and Kuina duel with real swords in the middle of the night
keyEvents.significance: Their final duel where they acknowledge each other's strength

keyEvents.description: Zoro and Kuina make their vow to become the world's greatest swordsman
keyEvents.significance: The birthplace of Zoro's lifelong dream and motivation

keyEvents.description: Kuina dies after falling down the dojo's staircase
keyEvents.significance: The tragic event that transforms Zoro's dream into a sacred mission

keyEvents.description: Koushirou gives Zoro the Wado Ichimonji at the dojo
keyEvents.significance: Zoro inherits Kuina's sword and commits to carrying both their dreams

notableResidents.relationship: Owner and master of the dojo
Former student who trained here in his youth
Former student and daughter of the master (deceased)

features: Home of the Wado Ichimonji before it was given to Zoro
Site of Zoro and Kuina's promise
